security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill consisting of markdown instructions. No code execution, file system access, network calls, or external commands are possible. The static analysis flagged SHA-256 hashes and common English words as security risks. All 25 findings are false positives. The skill provides safe guidelines for CSS color usage.

content.user_title: Add CSS colors using Material UI guidelines
content.value_statement: CSS color handling can become inconsistent when developers use direct color codes scattered across components. This skill provides clear guidelines for using Material UI color palettes and maintaining a centralized theme file for consistent styling.
actual_capabilities: Follow Material UI color palette guidelines
Reference theme colors instead of hardcoded values
Add new colors to centralized customColors section
Maintain consistent color usage across components
limitations: Does not generate color palettes automatically
Does not validate color contrast ratios
Limited to Material UI based projects
Does not provide color naming conventions

use_cases.title: Maintain consistent UI colors
use_cases.description: Ensure all components use theme-defined colors for consistent styling across the application.

use_cases.title: Enforce color standards
use_cases.description: Guide team members to add new colors through the proper theme file channels.

use_cases.title: Review color usage
use_cases.description: Check pull requests for direct color code usage and redirect to theme-based approach.

prompt_templates.title: Basic color lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: What Material UI colors are available in the theme for my component?

prompt_templates.title: Add new color
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to add a new color for the error state. How should I add it to the theme file?

prompt_templates.title: Refactor colors
prompt_templates.prompt: This component uses #ff0000 directly. Help me replace it with the proper theme color.

prompt_templates.title: Audit colors
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all direct color codes in the components and list the theme colors they should use instead.

output_examples.input: What colors should I use for a success button?
output: Use theme.palette.success.main for the main button color
Add new shades only in frontend/src/theme/theme.ts customColors section

output_examples.input: How do I add a new primary brand color?
output: Open the theme file at frontend/src/theme/theme.ts
Add your new color following the existing pattern
Reference it as theme.palette.primary.customColorName in components

best_practices: Always use theme.palette references instead of hardcoded hex values
Add new colors to the theme file's customColors section for centralized management
Follow Material UI color palette patterns when creating custom colors
anti_patterns: Using hex color codes directly in component files
Adding colors locally instead of through the theme file
Mixing different color formats (hex, rgb, named) in the same component

faq.question: Does this skill work with custom CSS frameworks?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for Material UI projects. Other frameworks may need different guidelines.

faq.question: What are the limits for custom colors?
faq.answer: There are no strict limits but colors should be added to the theme file's customColors section.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing design systems?
faq.answer: Add your colors to the theme file following the existing customColors pattern for consistency.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidelines and does not read or write any files directly.

faq.question: Why are direct color codes rejected?
faq.answer: Direct codes break consistency, make updates harder, and prevent theme-level changes from propagating.

faq.question: How does this compare to other color tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides project-specific guidelines rather than generic color generation or conversion features.
